inference:
The three pentagons make 5 angles around the center point. Each pentagon has 5 interior angles of measure 108 degrees. So all 5 interior angles of all three pentagons measure 5 * 108 = 540 degrees. Since the sum of the angles in a full rotation is 360 degrees, the measure of the gap is 360 - 540 = -180 degrees.
Final Answer: $\boxed{-180}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: The angles of a pentagon sum to $180(5-2) = 540$ degrees, so each angle of a regular pentagon is $540^\circ/5 = 108^\circ$.  Therefore, three of these angles sum to $3\cdot 108^\circ = 324^\circ$, which means the indicated angle measures $360^\circ - 324^\circ = \boxed{36^\circ}$.

ground_truth: The angles of a pentagon sum to $180(5-2) = 540$ degrees, so each angle of a regular pentagon is $540^\circ/5 = 108^\circ$.  Therefore, three of these angles sum to $3\cdot 108^\circ = 324^\circ$, which means the indicated angle measures $360^\circ - 324^\circ = \boxed{36^\circ}$.
